summary:
Central Europe is a vibrant region with a mix of cultures. It includes countries like Austria, Croatia, Czech Republic, Germany, and more. Historically, it has been influenced by various powers. For instance, the Ottoman Empire ruled parts of Croatia and Hungary, and the Polish-Lithuanian Commonwealth once included Poland and Lithuania.

After World War II, Central Europe was divided into Eastern and Western blocs during the Cold War. Recently, this region has been working together more, with groups like the Visegr√°d Four promoting cooperation. Writers and thinkers played a big role in this "strategic awakening," speaking out against past oppression.
title: Central Europe
